author: Staff Reporter
text:
: More than 100 enthusiasts have sent in their applications to be a part of the start-up warehouse that was inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Tuesday.

The warehouse is similar to the one in Bengaluru.

The State government, in association with NASSCOM, has worked on this venture. The plan to set up this warehouse was announced by the government in 2013.

“We have received more than 100 applications. The first level of screening will begin soon,” said K. Purushothaman, Regional Director -Tamil Nadu and Kerala, Nasscom.

“This warehouse will boost the start-up ecosystem in the State. We will handhold the entrepreneurs, mentor them and also help them with funding,” he added.

It is also learnt that a committee has been formed to shortlist the start-ups.

Lakshmi Narayanan, Vice Chairman of Cognizant, would lead this initiative.

“We have provided the basic infrastructure and the hardware part,” said Atul Anand, managing director, Electronics Corporation of Tamil Nadu.
title: Start-up warehouse goes live
